channel.title: My First Sigs EVER
channel.description:
[center][glow=red,2,300]Hello and welcome to my post on My First Sigs Ever so would you please rate it as a new photoshop sig maker and not a 1337 sig maker thanks![/glow][/center]
[center][b]Here is my first sig![/b]
[IMG]http://i88.photobucket.com/albums/k184/V_I_D_O/RoxmySoxCha0s.jpg[/img]
[b]I made this using photoshop as my first sig i had another go but it got wierd so i decided to make a new one here is the new one.[/b]
[IMG]http://i88.photobucket.com/albums/k184/V_I_D_O/FirebyCha0s.jpg[/img]
[b]This was my second go rate it please thanks![/b]
[b]and lastly my third and final go![/b]
[IMG]http://i88.photobucket.com/albums/k184/V_I_D_O/PrinceCha0s.jpg[/img]
[b]Rate all of them please and personally i think the last one is the best!
Credits go to all the people who helped in the childboard: Graphics Tutorials
Yours Faithily C Cha0s C[/b][/center]

item.title: My First Sigs EVER
item.dc:creator: @C_Cha0s_C C Cha0s C
item.description:
@C_Cha0s_C wrote:

Thanks for your feedback and ill keep it in mind

item.title: My First Sigs EVER
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

[quote=“premier, post:2, topic:30930”]1st: on the top one the renders dont really go together at all… i would take out the guy on the right… and what are the three sirf board shapes on the face on the left? i yhink it makes it look bad

2nd:i like this one best. however im not a big fan of fastballs logo style… i find that it only works well for him, try normal text. i like the streaks that make it look like its moving(howd you do that?)

3rd:again im not a fan of fastballs logo for other people. but why did you not blend the arms of the render?i think it makes it look funny.

i am by no means a expert… i am a beginer as well i just wrote some things i noticed…

go check out elitegfx.net as well… there is lots of good stuff there[/quote]

Because people forget to get a color from the background and color the logo that :rolleyes:

Read full topic

item.description:
@ScotaloticaS wrote:

Very good shot for a first when i started i was no were nere as good as that but read so more tuts and you will be as good as me… (Wow. i sound soo upmyself)

Read full topic

item.title: My First Sigs EVER
item.dc:creator: @premier premier
item.description:
@premier wrote:

1st: on the top one the renders dont really go together at all… i would take out the guy on the right… and what are the three sirf board shapes on the face on the left? i yhink it makes it look bad

2nd:i like this one best. however im not a big fan of fastballs logo style… i find that it only works well for him, try normal text. i like the streaks that make it look like its moving(howd you do that?)

3rd:again im not a fan of fastballs logo for other people. but why did you not blend the arms of the render?i think it makes it look funny.

i am by no means a expert… i am a beginer as well i just wrote some things i noticed…

go check out elitegfx.net as well… there is lots of good stuff there

Read full topic

item.description:
@C_Cha0s_C wrote:

[center][glow=red,2,300]Hello and welcome to my post on My First Sigs Ever so would you please rate it as a new photoshop sig maker and not a 1337 sig maker thanks![/glow][/center]

[center]Here is my first sig!

I made this using photoshop as my first sig i had another go but it got wierd so i decided to make a new one here is the new one.

This was my second go rate it please thanks!

and lastly my third and final go!

[b]Rate all of them please and personally i think the last one is the best!

Credits go to all the people who helped in the childboard: Graphics Tutorials

Yours Faithily C Cha0s C[/b][/center]
